Steps.Message: Update at 10:27 - Hi, it's Aaron from the text messaging team. I'm sorry you haven't received a text from us yet. Due to the impact of the strong winds and heavy rain from Storm Bella, we are currently unable to update customers as often as we would like. Our engineers are on the way to investigate reports of a grounded overhead cable. We're currently estimating we'll have all the power back on between 14:30 and 15:30. We will continue to communicate with the team and update you as often as possible.

We became aware of this power cut at 08:59. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

Logs.Comment: Update at 10:27 - Hi, it's Aaron from the text messaging team. I'm sorry you haven't received a text from us yet. Due to the impact of the strong winds and heavy rain from Storm Bella, we are currently unable to update customers as often as we would like. Our engineers are on the way to investigate reports of a grounded overhead cable. We're currently estimating we'll have all the power back on between 14:30 and 15:30. We will continue to communicate with the team and update you as often as possible.

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers had to redirect power due to a fault on the electricity network.
